content: Does rust have any minimum supported version of openbsd, freebsd, etc.? For the tier 1 platforms, the platform support page provides versions, but the tier 2 platforms mostly don't.
Context: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/78572 wants to use something that was introduced in netbsd in july 2018, but the CI seems to be using a netbsd toolchain from march 2018.

Ah, apparently the libc crate does already support what this PR needs, regardless of toolchain version. So not really a problem in this case. But I'd still be interested in the policy for which versions of tier 2 systems to support.
